answers.answer: Hulahut,I'm so sorry you're going through all of this right now.  I got tears in my eyes reading your pet post, remembering having to put my dog to sleep and holding her during the injection.  That was four years ago!  I still miss her like mad, but mostly now I can smile at the great memories of her and know that she lived a good long life.  I know you will reach that point someday, but for now unfortunately you have to grieve.I had to do a 5-hour glucose screen a few years ago.  Be sure to drink a lot of water before the test, because they didn't let me drink during it, and by the end I was so dehydrated I was surprised they could still get blood out of me.  Also, I packed a peanut butter sandwich to eat in the car before I even attempted to drive home.  From what I understand, it is rare that someone with gestational diabetes continues to have diabetes after the baby arrives.Hang in there, honey!

Hi I had a level of 154 for my first test so I had to do the 3hr test also.  I went in around 9:00 for mine.  They took blood then I had to drink the yucky cherry stuff--I hate anything cherry.  Then at 1,2 and 3 hr they took more blood.  I got my results like a day later and unfortunatley I failed that one also.  My levels went to 170 during the second hr.  Right now I just trying to watch my diet--if the levels get higher they may have to use medication.  From what I understand this is  more pregnancy related than anything, however they say your chances of getting diabetes when you get older does increase. I'm sure family history and diet play a part also.  They also seemed to think my "advanced maternal age"(40) has some part to play too. Good Luck and try to relax.  Also I'm so sorry to hear about the loss of your dog. Take Care

It was a long time ago (14 1/2 years), but I failed my tests with my 1st daughter as well but my doctor was really old fashion (and perhaps a little senile).  They were more worried about my hypoglycemia turning into diabetes than anything else but nothing ever came of it, with either pregnancy.

isnt it annoying they wont let you go with only those few points over? GRR. The lab tech when i did the 3 hour said a lot of doctors will make you do the three hour test, any many women pass because of this.I did the three hour and passed :) It wasnt horrible. They said stop eating after 10PM the night before - i was snoring by then so not too bad!Also, the glucose drink fills you up somewhat that you dont get too hungry. Definetely bring something with you for after or drive directly to a nearby restaurant because by noon you will be hungry!Good luck - bring a book :)

I am 38 weeks and failed both my one-hour and three-hour.  The fasting wasn't that bad, they let me drink water after I drank the sugar stuff, because not only did they stick me 6 times in three hours I had to pee in a cup every time they drew blood.  I agree take something to read, it's alooooonnggg wait if you don't.  It's not so bad, but the poking did start to get to me after the third time, I don't know why they don't just put a IV thing in your hand or something.  I didn't feel dizzy or anything, but I don't usually eat breakfast, so it didn't bother me.  I am on a pill medication twice a day.  I am just glad I don't have to do injections.  I do hear though that most women pass the three hour.  Also I have heard and read that your more likely to have type 2 diabetes later in life.  Sometimes though they discover that you already had it but just didn't know until you got pregnant.  So it can go either way as for long term problems.  I actully lost four lbs just half-@$$ing the diet.  I stay away from sugar as much as possible and eat a little less.  I lost the pounds between week 34 and 37.  I started out prepregnancy at 205 and now weigh in at about 230, so I have gained like 25lbs total, and 5 of those were just in the last two weeks.  Good luck and don't stress to much you'll be ok.

question: Hi ladies:I'm home now (for those of you who read/posted to my grief issues).  Sigh.  I just recieved my glucose screen results - 139.  I have to do the three hour test on Thursday now.  The tech said that anyone over 134 has to do the 3 hour test.  Who did this? How awful was it fasting the night before?  I go in at 8am - I can't imagine not eating or drinking for that entire time - how will I not faint?  In any event, I have no idea what to do with this info.  I am not together right now with my recent pet loss, and now this (I know, it could be a lot worse).  But, still...  what next? Am I going to have diabetes forever now?  Sorry for the multiple posts today...
title: Glucose Screen Not Good - Anyone with this Experience?
